intro: Dianthus coronarius, commonly known as the Crown Daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a central cluster of pink or red stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has basal leaves that are linear to lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The flowers bloom in spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
